_comment: Created by rreed on 06/07/2017 08:48:12 using v2.7
title: How does cervical cancer mortality compare internationally over time?
analysis_commentary:
Cervical cancer mortality rates in the UK fell between 2001 and 2006 (from 3.6 to 2.8 deaths per 100,000 women) and since then they have plateaued at 2.7 deaths per 100,000 women â€“ one of the highest mortality rates of all the comparator countries. Italy consistently has the lowest death rate of only one death per 100,000 women. Incidence rates for cervical cancer in Italy and the UK are very similar and have shown a decline: in Italy the rate fell from 9.1 per 100,000 women in 2000 to 6.7 per 100,000 women in 2012, while in the UK the incidence rate fell from 9.3 per 100,000 women in 2000 to 7.1 per 100,000 women in 2012.

Updated June 2017.
data_source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, Health Data
